The 2023 budget law includes an annex related to fiscal risks with information on explicit and implicit contingent liabilities (PPPs, legal, subnationals, etc).

The Quarterly Public Debt Bulletin (March 2023) reports on contingent liabilities by type and beneficiaries (loans, PPPs, SOEs, etc) and the Fiscal strategy statement FY2023/24 also reports on SOE debt (page 9).
The FRS (2023) discloses debt-related CLs, including PPPs, SOEs and onlending. No guaranteed debt
The Fiscal Risk Statement FY2023/24 contains information regarding PPPs, guarantees on SOEs, and subnationals, among others.
Fiscal risk statement for 2023 is published
The FRS (2022) discloses debt-related CLs, incl. guaranteed debt by beneficiary. The 2022 Public Debt Bulletin discloses also the information (pages 28-29)

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Debt Statistical Bulletin meets the minimum requirement and reports on both explicit and implicit debt-related CLs;  Further details are provided in the FRS and a Report on Risk-Related to Main Public Investments
Chapter 6 of the 2023 budget report meets the minimum requirements and reports on explicit and implicit debt-related CLs

The Annual Public Debt Bulletin includes detailed breakdown of contigentent liabilities. Publication of Arrears Clearance, Debt Relief and Restructuring Strategy. No statistics on collaterilized debt could be found

The Annual Public Debt Management Report  (2021/2022) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 10). Chapter 15 (page 50) provides information about contingent liabilities (including guarantees).

The inaugural Fiscal Risk Report (FRR; 2023) reports on guaranteed debt and comfort letters by beneficiary and the Quarterly Debt Bulletin reports on arrears. No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees on the MEF website
Information about guarantees to SOEs by beneficiaries in MoF (Active Sovereign Guarantees) but no CLs identification and quantification
Guarantees are described in the quarterly debt report with some details about guarantors.

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary), PPP-related guarantees and the stock of domestic arrears is a minimum requirement. The latest Debt Statistical Bulletin (2022 Q2) reports on loan guarantee by beneficiary (page 24) and the stock of arrears (page 12). No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees (e.g., the water sector) on the MoF website
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement.The MTEF & FSP (2024-2026) reports on debt-related CLs (pages 46), incl. loan and PPP-related guarantees
The Annual Debt Report (2022) and the statistical bulletin (June 2023) discloses the loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 29-30). No analsyis of SOE debt

The Report on the Outstanding Loans/Debt Including Guarantees of the Seventeen Largest State-Owned Enterprises does disagregrate guaranteed debt by beneficiary. The FRS included in the Fiscal Strategy Statement for 2022-2024 does not quantify loan and PPP-related guarantees

Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary) and account payables is a minimum requirement. The Debt Bulletin (June 2022) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 4) and account payables (page 5). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

The Public Debt, Grants and Guarantees Report (2023 Q1) reports on guaranteed debt by beneficiary and the arrears. Also, the quarterly report for 2023 provides information about SOEs guaranteed and non-guaranteed debt.No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the MFNP website (e.g., in the White Paper)
The Recurrent Budget for 2023 discloses information on guarantees (Annex 9).
The Public Debt Report (2022) reports the stock of arrears and SOEs (including guarantees).The collateralized debt is not yet reported
The MTDS reports on guarantees covering loans (with a breakdown by beneficiary) and PPP (Appendices 1-2). There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs

The Public Debt Report (2023 Q2; pages 3-4) and the In-Year Financial Report (end-June 2023; page 12) report on external arrears and domestic expenditure arrears, respectively. There is not yet a dedicated publication/chapter on debt-related CLs
The quarterly debt report provides info total amounts of contigent liabities. However, the country does not have any.
Reporting on loan guarantees (by beneficiary is a minimum requirement. The Annual Public Debt Report (2022/23) discloses guaranteed debt by beneficiary (annex 2, pages 26).
The MYEFO (2023) reports on loan guarantees by beneficiary (Table 26) and the stock of arrears (pages 50-51).
The Annual Debt Management Report (Dec. 2022) discloses guaranteed debt data by beneficiary, as well as include the amount of validated arrears accepted by the government (page 14).
Information on guarantees is provided in the quarterly report. However, data are  incomplete.
The Public Debt Bulletin quantifies guarantees by beneficiairy (July-December 2022, page 8). No statistics could be found on PPP-related guarantees on the GPFD website.
The 2022 ARDMM reports on contingent liabilities by type and beneficiaries (loans, SOEs, etc) and the stock of arrears (see annex 1, page 37). No statistics on collaterillized debt could be found

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. The Public Debt Status Report (2021) discloses loan guarantees by beneficiary. The Fiscal Risk Statement discusses CLs. No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the MoF website
Some information on fiscal risks and contingent liabilities (legal and PPPs) in the budget report 2023.
The Statistical Debt Bulletin (Sept 2023) reports on guaranteed debt  by beneficiary. No statistics on PPP-related guarantees could be found on the MEF website
Information on guarantees and PPPs are provided in section 4.
The Budget Statement for FY 2024 includes guarantees by beneficiaries (page 69), but it does not include SOEs.
The Annual Public Debt Management Report (FY21/22) discloses loan guarantees by beneficiary (page 21) and external arrears (page 27). It fails to provide the other minimum required elements

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of domestic arrears, and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. The Public Debt Report (2021) reports on arrears (page 6) and dedicates a section on CLs (Section 7) with guaranteed debt by beneficiary (page 37). It does not yet report on resource-backed loans and PPP-related guarantees. Neither the Budget Statement and Economic Policy for FY 2022 nor the PFM Strategy for 2022-2026 reports on debt-related CLs
The Annual Debt Portfolio Report (2022) provides limited information regarding guaranteed debt by beneficiary.
Total contingent liabilities (including guarantees by beneficiary) are reported.tatistics on PPP-related guarantees  are not yet available on the CAA or DGB websites
Information about contingent liabilities from SOEs is found in Annual report 2022 (Table 18, page 22). It includes information regarding arrears (page 9). The collateralized debt is not yet reported
N.A.
Statistical bulletin include information regarding SOE debt (Annex. Table 12). However, there is no information regarding guarantees.
No statistics could be found on the MoPF website
The Public Sector Debt Statistical Bulletin (2023) does not report on guaranteed debt by beneficiary.
The debt statistical bulletin does not report on guaranteed debt by beneficiary and outstanding arrears
No statistics could be found posted on the MOF website
Reporting on possible PPP-related guarantees is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MoF website
The Quarterly Public Debt Bulletin (March 2023) reports on contingent liabilities by type but it does not provide details regarding beneficiaries.
No statistics could be found on the MdF website
There is no information posted on public debt on the MoF and CBY websites
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MEF website
The FRS included in the 2023 Budget Law does not quantifying debt-related CLs (pages 1040-1066).
Reporting on loan guarantees by beneficiary and the stock of arrears is a minimum requirement. No statistics could be found on the MFBPE website
n.a.

Reporting on guaranteed debt is a minimum requirement. The MoF website could not be accessed

Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees, the stock of arrears, and collaterilized debt is a minimum requirement. Only the external arrears are reported in the CBOS External Debt Position at end-June 2022
Reporting on loan (by beneficiary)- and PPP-related guarantees  (e.g., Mutsamudu Port) and the stock of external arrears is a minimim requirement. No statistics could be found on the MFBSB  website

Neither the Debt Statistical Bulletin (only the stock of guarantees, section IV) not the FRS (2022-24) report on guaranteed debt in detail. The Budgetary Risk Statement (2022-24) provides some basic information regarding SOEs but without the details.
The Annual Debt Report (2022) does report on guaranteed debt on one SOE. However, there are not details about the terms and condtions of the loan.
